contactmanager

Class ContactManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • contactmanager.ContactManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContactManager, ContactManagerPlus, Serializable

    public class ContactManagerImpl
extends Object
implements ContactManagerPlus
    Class to Manage contacts and Meetings
    Since:
    24 February 2015
    Author:
    Oliver Smart <osmart01@dcs.bbk.ac.uk>
    See Also:
    ContactManager, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContactManagerImpl

        public ContactManagerImpl()
        construct a brand new ContactManager with no attempt to read from a save state file. Call to flush() will save state to the default filename "contacts.txt".

      • ContactManagerImpl

        public ContactManagerImpl(String fileName)
        Construct the contact manager with data from a save-state-file. N.B. this file will normally be overwritten when flush() method is later called to save the state. Note that the retrieved file name got from the save-state-file is ignored and the argument fileName will be used. See FileSaveRetrieveImpl for details of the save-state-file format used.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the save-state-file name
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if there is a problem opening or reading from the file
        RuntimeException - if there is a problem in opening the file, reading from it or decoding the ContactManager from it

    • Method Detail

      • addFutureMeeting

        public int addFutureMeeting(Set<Contact> contacts,
                            Calendar date)
        "Add a new meeting to be held in the future."
        Specified by:
        addFutureMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting
        date - the date on which the meeting will take place
        Returns:
        the ID for the meeting
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting is set for a time in the past, or if any contact is not in list of current contacts

      • getPastMeeting

        public PastMeeting getPastMeeting(int id)
        "Returns the PAST meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none."
        Specified by:
        getPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the meeting
        Returns:
        the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - "if there is a meeting with that ID happening in the future" (i.e. stored as a future meeting)

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
        "Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates."
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Calendar date)
        "Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates. Additional specification from Moodle cw4 discussion forum: SERGIO GUTIERREZ-SANTOS 15 December 2014, 5:23 PM "The method must return also past meetings if it is called with a past date as parameter. The name is confusing, a better name would have been getMeetingList(Calendar) or even getMeetingListOn(Calendar). We apologise for the confusion.""
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the list of meetings

      • getPastMeetingList

        public List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact contact)
        "Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates."
        Specified by:
        getPastMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of past meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • addNewPastMeeting

        public void addNewPastMeeting(Set<Contact> contacts,
                              Calendar date,
                              String text)
        "Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past."
        Specified by:
        addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of participants
        date - the date on which the meeting took place
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the list of contacts is empty, or any of the contacts does not exist
        NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        IllegalStateException - if meeting is set for the future (N.B. this is missing from Interface specification but needs to be done for consistency).

      • addMeetingNotes

        public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                            String text)
        "Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date." N.B. if used to add notes to a past meeting, the new notes replace the existing ones (rather than being appended).
        Specified by:
        addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the meeting
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting does not exist
        IllegalStateException - if the meeting is set for a date in the future
        NullPointerException - if the notes are null

      • addNewContact

        public void addNewContact(String name,
                          String notes)
        "Create a new contact with the specified name and notes."
        Specified by:
        addNewContact in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the contact.
        notes - notes to be added about the contact.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if identical contact ID error occurs (this should be an "impossible error")

      • flush

        public void flush()
        "Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it." Note that the file name used for the save are set in whatever constructor was used and at present cannot be altered. See FileSaveRetrieveImpl for details of the file format used for the save.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface ContactManager
        Throws:
        UncheckedIOException - if there is a problem opening or writing to the file
        RuntimeException - encoding the ContactManager into a string to write

      • getAllContacts

        public List<Contact> getAllContacts()
        Description copied from interface: ContactManagerPlus
        A simple getter for all contacts. Added it because it would be really useful in actually writing a program!
        Specified by:
        getAllContacts in interface ContactManagerPlus
        Returns:
        list of all the contacts

      • setPretendNow

        public void setPretendNow(Calendar pretendNow)
        Used to set a false current date in place of the real actual date/time "now". Useful for testing and may be for the program.
        Specified by:
        setPretendNow in interface ContactManagerPlus
        Parameters:
        pretendNow - the date/time to treat as "now".

      • getPretendNow

        public Calendar getPretendNow()
        Getter for pretendNow - the overriding date for "now".
        Specified by:
        getPretendNow in interface ContactManagerPlus
        Returns:
        the date/time to treat as "now" or null if no pretend is set (so real system time will be used).
